dialogues.text: If it’s my name, don’t tell me. I, for one, don’t wanna know how I go. (beat) Look what I found. Stella sees a rare photo of SARAH BELLOWS in a hazel hosp gown, surrounded by a team of doctors, unsmiling. She is simple with a wide smile and unnatural curved spine

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: It’s her. Ramén reads the lab coats insignia.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: “RLP.H. oe

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: I know those letters. Riverwell Psychiatric Hospital. Upstate.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Get this- This photo was taken the year before her whole family died. As Stella and Auggie extrapolate -- Ramén flips to an illustration in Sarah’s book that grabs attention. It’s entitled ‘HIGH BEAMS’ with an image of a scared woman behind the wheel and headlights following he

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: So she didn’t disappear, she was locked away.  58.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Can you imagine being committed into a nut house at our age? Ramén looks up from the Book.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: What was your mom’s name?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Dinah, why? Ramén shakes off his presumption and flips to the next pa

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: No reason. Stella can tell he knows something, but is afraid to ask.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: (concerned) Where’s Alice? She should be here by now. Ramén turns to the next unwritten chapter - ‘The Red Spot The story still blank.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: As long as there isn’t a new story, she’s probably all right. Alice shuffles into the library, nerves on high. Her head down and half of her face is covered by her hair.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late. Do you know how terrible it was to keep my mouth shut?

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: It's okay. We weren’t worried.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I uh, I'll just be a minute. I need to freshen up.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: You look fresh to me... Alice beelines out, ignoring him. Auggie studies her illu Manner. Something is not right.  59.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Maybe you should hold off on telling her how you feel. It’s not like we're under any unusual stress, or curse or anything. Stella cracks a rare smile. Auggie isn’t laughing.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: (to Ramén) I hope you're next. As they return to their research -- CLOSE ON: A small BEAD OF BLOOD drops onto the blank chap page of ‘The Red Spot’, creating... A RED SPOT.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Ramén. Your nose. Ramén wipes his bloody nose, confused. He notices the RED SPOT on the blank page, then pushes himself away from the Bellows Book, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: OH SHIT! The red spot. The red spot! I AM next! The Librarian SHUSHES them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first sentence to ‘THE RED SPOT’ APPEARS before their eyes, as if scrawled by an invisible author...

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Ohhhh god... ohgodohgodohgod. BLACK INK seeps up through the page, bleeding into creepy imagery. The story slowly appears, word by word, like spiderweb being spun... Stella, Auggie and Ramén surround the book, anxious to re what is scrawled next...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice is lost, looking for the bathroom. A passing LIBRAR ASSISTANT approaches, friendly.  60.

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARIAN ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Afternoon, may I help you - (recoils) Oh honey, you need to get that cherry checked out. Alice looks up, her hair pulled back behind her ear revea -- a MASSIVE PIMPLE on her cheek. It’s a plumper.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: (mortified) It’s stress. Where’s your nearest washroom?

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARIAN ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Here, let me show you. The Librarian Assistant leads her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Auggie watch the cursed story unfold before th eyes as Ramén paces, stressed out.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna know. Don’t tell me. It’s gonna be twisted. (on second thought) Yeah I do. I wanna know -- Stella reads as fast as it is written --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (reading) “,.. it was there in the washroom where poor Alice would discover the red spot..." It’s ALICE!

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: It’s Alice? Thank god!

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: The washroom! Auggie bolts up from the table and races out. Stella thro look to Ramén - how selfish of you.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: What?! I thought I was gonna die. She grabs the book and runs after. Ramdén chases.  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three skid on the linoleum, looking for the washroom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice enters the washroom alone. She goes to the mirror t inspect the largest zit ever seen in the history of cinem Red and raw. She touches the pimple, but it hurts so bad. It must be popped. She turns on the hot water, steaming. Then wets a paper t to gently compress it. When she leans back down to soak her towel... SARAH BELLOWS is in the mirror’s reflection. Wet and smil with the crazed, simple face of a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HALLWAY —- LIBRARY - SAME TIME Stella, Ramén and Auggie charge down the hallway toward a door labeled WOMEN. Auggie hesitates for the briefest of moments -- then BUSTS in.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Alice! INT. WOMEN’S WASHROOM —- LIBRARY -— CONTINUOUS They come to a stop.... It’s empty. Panic on their faces.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: There must be another washroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three charge back out, lost and confused. Stella find simple MAP PLAQUE on the wall by some stairs.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Upstairs! They follow Auggie up the stairs, two steps at a time.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice gets a closer look at the pimple when - it almost l like SOMETHING moved inside it. Her heart stops. She wipes the mirror and inspects it clo Again, something moves just under the skin... Suddenly, an ingrown BLACK HAIR pokes out... Ugh gross... INT. WOMEN’S WASHROOM - SECOND FLOOR - SAME TIME Stella, Ramén and Auggie explode into the second floor washroom. But Alice isn’t there. Only a CUSTODIAN.

dialogues.speaker: WHERE IS SHE
dialogues.text: Auggie eyes a STAFF NAME TAG on the custodian, then urgen

dialogues.speaker: IS THERE A STAFF WASHROOM
dialogues.text: Before he can answer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusted, Alice inspects the short black hair sticking o of her boil. She delicately tugs on it - trying to remove ingrown hair, only for - The hair TWITCHES, as if alive. That’s no hair, it’s a le Alice SCREAMS and places her hand over the pimple, just a A SWARM OF BABY SPIDERS escape through her fingers, sprea across her face!!! SHE SCREAMS BLOODY MURDER! Alice takes her hand off her face. An endless stream of t spiders crawl out of her pimple. The more she claws away, faster they come out. The Librarian enters to see Alice bristled with creepy crawlies. Alice reaches out for help amidst her thrashing but the scared librarian only runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auggie, Stella and Ramén plow past the startled Librarian

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter to find -- A LARGE BLACK MASS WRITHING and SCREAMING in the corner. vast majority of Alice is covered in spiders as they spre across the floor like WRIGGLY OOZE! Auggie and Stella instantly take off their jackets and sw them away. But there’s too many. Ram6én RUNS OUT into the HALLWAY -- and sees a bucket of water. Thinking quick, he picks it up and RACES BACK INTO BATHROOM --— He drenches Alice, washing the remaining spiders away. Stella can only watch as Auggie drops to the floor to cra Alice, left catatonic. Her skin pock-marked with bites. Stunned patrons crowd the door, staring. Alice twitches i Auggie’s arms, unable to cope. She’s alive, but not well.

dialogues.speaker: HELP
dialogues.text: The crowd doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: CALL AN AMBULANCE
dialogues.text: A concerned patron runs off. Auggie rocks Alice, stroking her hair, trying to calm her She mutters, unaware of her surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: ... They're all over me. Get them off. Get them off...

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. You’re going to be okay. Alice’s eyes flutter open. Lost and confused.  64.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: ... My dress. It's ripped. I can't go out like this...

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: It’s a nice dress, Alice... Don’t worry, you look just fine... Auggie looks to Stella, his eyes filled with sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights flash as paramedics roll Alice’s gurney into the waiting ambulance for ‘Riverwell Psychiatric Hospital’.

dialogues.speaker: AT AMBULANCE
dialogues.text: Sickly, Alice stutters. Unable to cope.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I saw her in the mirror. I saw her in the mirror. The paramedics shake their heads. She’s a lost cause.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE AMBULANCE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Steinberg stifles herself with tissue as her husband in a heated exchange with Deputy Hobbs.

dialogues.speaker: MR. STEINBERG
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Tom! You haven’t even found my son and now this?!

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: We’re doing everything we can.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. STEINBERG
dialogues.text: Where’s Roy? Why isn’t the Sheriff talking to us?

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: He just found his son’s corpse, Darlene. You might want to give him some space. Mrs. Steinberg breaks down into hysterics. Mr. Steinberg stares at the Deputy -- how can you be so cruel?  65. DEPUTY HOBBS (CONT’D) I’m sorry, we're all on edge. All I can say at this time is we have a warrant out for all of their arrests. We'll figure this out. Deputy Hobbs eyes the Corvair Monza, knowing Ramén has to return for it eventually.

dialogues.speaker: A FEW BLOCKS AWAY
dialogues.text: Ramén nervously lights a cigarette as Auggie watches from afar, keeping their distance. Stella’s on a bench, starin ‘The Red Spot’. She looks up with tears in her eyes --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Alice dies at the end of her story. (desperate to others) But she’s not dead. We saved her. We saved her, right?

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: There’s no coming back from that. She doesn't even know her name. (despondent) And now they think we’re all responsible.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: No, they think I am. Ram6n flicks the butt of his cig then takes off his jacke

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck it. I’m turning myself in.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA/AUGGIE
dialogues.text: What? / Why?!

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: To tell them you’ve got nothing to do with this.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Neither do you. What good will that do anyone?

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Look, I’m not that thick. I know they won’t believe me. But if they give me enough time- if I can make them see- maybe they can help us?  66.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: And what happens when you’re locked up and the next story comes for you? What help can we be then? Ram6n can’t stomach conceding the point. Furious, he thro his jacket, feeling helpless.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s been a long day. We can’t think. We need sleep.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: The next story is called ‘The Dream’. You really feel like closing your eyes?

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Then we’ll take shifts. One of us always has eyes on the story. (direct) We get through the night, together. Ramén and Stella share a look and nod, in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Where? They’1l be looking for us.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Where they won’t find us. Ramén takes one last look at his Corvair Monza, then pick his jacket and leaves. Auggie and Stella head out, exhaus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Milner, his face weary over the loss of his son, stands over the teen’s research left behind. His fingers trace over the photo of Sarah Bellows. His mi races, trying to make sense of it. He taps on the doctor besides Sarah. It’s almost as if he recognizes the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school parking lot is empty in its off hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auggie shivers while Ramén jostles the locked doors. Stel keeps warm in his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Any other bright ideas?

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Anyone got a pen? Stella shakes her head. Auggie hands over a fountain pen.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Careful, it’s my favorite -- Ram6n twists and rips the pen’s clip off. Auggie deflates

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Now it’s my favorite. Ram6én uses the clip to pick the lock. The door POPS open

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (playful) Wonder how a war hero feels having a hood for a son?

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Never said it was untrue. After they enter -- SERIES OF SHOTS over “Hurdy Gurdy Man” by Donovan. «+. Ramon breaks into the School Nurse’s office, snagging some pain pills, bandages and pillows. ... Stella enters the Faculty Lounge, claiming a comfy co She revisits the book - the newest chapter still blank. «+. Auggie pillages the cafeteria kitchen. He piles choco milk, snacks, and left over Peanut Butter Cake on a tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ram6én enters with an arm load of pillows to see -- Stella, cradling her knees on the floor while she reads ‘ Beams’. Tears run down her cheeks as she stares at an illustration of a frightened woman driving at night. He sits down beside her as she wipes her eyes.  68.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Is it your mom? Did you read it? Stella nods.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: She was the one who wanted to move here. She told my dad - there was something about Mill Valley. She tries her best to smile through the painful memory.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Even when I see her picture, I don’t recognize her face. I can only remember her voice...

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: They were arguing that night. All I can remember is... she couldn’t take it anymore and drove off. (beat) My dad had to borrow the neighbor's truck to follow her. He had too much, but he wanted to apologize... She smiles as she wipes a tear. Ramén listens. FLASHBACK: DINAH MICHAELS (38) drives a GREEN SEDAN upset straining to see through the night’s low fog.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was late. And dark. And this truck, that she didn’t recognize, starts turning on their high beams. In the rear view mirror, a brief FLASH of HIGH BEAMS. A moment would pass, and then another blinding flash of lig

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON
dialogues.text: Stella knows this story by heart. She doesn’t need to rea

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She tried to let them pass, but they kept flashing. The more she tried to get away, the more agitated they got. (catatonic) The lights. On. Off. On. Off...  69. FLASHBACK: Nervous and frightened, Dinah speeds up --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He saw it happen... but there was no way to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Stop what? The pursuing truck keeps their high beams on, blinding he

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Everyone thought it was his fault... That he caused the accident... Even me... (then) But the story says she wasn't alone in the car. IN THE TRUCK, Oren witnesses a FIGURE rise up in the back seat of the sedan. He lets out a HORSE SCREAM -— IN THE SEDAN, Dinah sees SARAH BELLOWS rise up in her rearview mirror. She GASPS in fright, then -- THE GREEN SEDAN suddenly jerks off the road, causing the automobile to TWIST and violently CRASH to a dusty stop. The Truck hits the brakes. Oren runs out, wracked with gr

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON
dialogues.text: Stella. Lost in the story. Ramén hangs on her every word.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Every time he turned on his high beams, he was trying to warn her. (breaks down to Ramén) There was someone else- Just like he said- But I didn’t believe him- No one believed him- Because it was her- It was Sarah-- He puts a consoling arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hated him so much, I wanted to kill myself. He kisses her on the head. Hurting for her.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Stories hurt. Stories heal.  70.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Why didn’t I believe him? He turns the page, helping to put that chapter behind her She stares at the next unwritten story. The title is --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘The Dream’... (numb ) I wish this was all a dream. Ramén holds her tight. The sentiment is mutual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning Oregon rain patters and streaks down windows. First sun stirs Ramén awake on the couch. He looks for Stella, a crinkled sheet beside him where she had slept. He only sees Auggie snoring, with the Book open on his ch covered in hostess wrappers and chocolate milk boxes. Stella enters, drying her hair from a morning shower. She lowers the towel to reveal newly shorn hair. She touches new pixie cut, unsure. Ramén smiles, showing his approval He approaches. She holds back, vulnerable. Their lips wan to touch... But her eyes fall on Auggie, in fright --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Auggie! Wake up! Auggie jolts awake. Ramén sees it too.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: The Book --!

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Shit... Auggie brushes food wrappers and debris way and finds -- story has already been written. He jumps up, startled. They pace, losing their wits.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: When was it written --  71.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know! Stella marches over and grabs the book, reading:

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: “Last night, Augustus Hilderbrandt had a strange dream. He dreamed he was in a red room-- " Auggie rips it out of her hand and SLAMS the book closed.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: No, man. That’s my name. IT’S MY

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Give us the Book.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to know how I die. I can't know!

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: We can’t stop it unless we know what happens.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: We have to read it.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Why read it when I dreamt it! Stella and Ramén back down. Auggie takes a seat, biting h nails. His nerves rattled.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was in this hallway. With so many doors. And I could hear these... voices. They were angry. Like they wanted to get out. I wanted to too.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (quiet, to Ramén) You think he was dreaming of Riverwell?

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Where they locked Sarah up? They might know what happened to her.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: I ran into this... red room. And I mean everything was red. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like it was blood. But it wasn’t mine. (horrified) And then Sarah... she was reaching out to me. Smiling. I couldn’t move my legs. Or my arms. She told me --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: --- You may be the next. Auggie nods, it’s burned into his memory.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have to go there.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: You said it yourself, the stories are clues. We need to read -- Auggie pulls the Book out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: No. I don’t wanna know how I die.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: You’re a smart kid, Auggie. We need to see what happens. At least let Stella have a look.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: (rationalizing) Riverwell Psychiatric. I’m in. But I don’t wanna know. I just hafta... avoid red rooms. Yeah. That’1l work. If I’m not in one, I'll live, right? (delirious) Please. Don’t think I’m crazy. I’m conscious... this will work. Stella and Ramén share a look. Skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: I’ll drive. Ramén runs out of the room. Stella and Auggie share a confused look, then -- Ramén runs back, suddenly remembering he has no car.  73.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t ride bikes.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: They run into the hallway, only to hear -- OS FOOTSTEPS coming their way. They dart around the corne The PRINCIPAL whistles, flipping the keys to his Cadillac his hand. He sips his coffee and passes them, unnoticed. Stella, Ramén and Auggie’s sneak out behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Auggie pile into the Principals’ bronze boat o convertible. It’s nicer than anything they’ve been in. Ramén fidgets with the wires, hot wiring it. The engine R to life. They share a relieved smile and the car takes of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac cruises down the newly built freeway, leavin Mill Valley behind.

dialogues.speaker: DISK JOCKEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How did we get turned upside down? Maybe it’s me, or maybe it’s the end of the world. Maybe it’s time we ‘Reach Out of the Darkness’. “Reach Out of the Darkness” by Friends and Lover plays. .».. Stella closes her eyes and leans her head on the doo letting the wind kiss her face. «+. Auggie stretches out in the backseat. ... Ramoén steals a glance at Stella. She looks back. For brief moment, there isn’t a care in the world. «+. The Cadillac winds through Pacific Northwest wilderne EXT. MICHAELS’ HOME - MORNING Oren packs moving boxes into his truck’s flatbed. Sheriff Milner pulls up, blocking his driveway. Oren suspicious.  74.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: Oren. Stella around? He tenses, then returns packing. Alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: OREN
dialogues.text: What‘d she do now?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: Your family’s always in some sort of trouble. Oren slams his truck-bed closed, restraining his temper.

dialogues.speaker: OREN
dialogues.text: She didn’t come home last night. I don’t know where she is.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: Call us if she shows, you hear? Oren looks down, giving no response. Sheriff Milner returns to his squad car and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac passes a RIVERWELL PSYCHIATRIC HOSPITAL sign They pull up towards a sprawling behemoth built with such pristine symmetry it’s unsettling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within an institutional corridor, a rigid RECEPTION NURSE looks up to find Stella, Ramdén and Auggie. A lit cigaret hangs from her pursed lips. Moans and shrieks are heard O

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: We need to see the records of a former patient named Sarah Bellows.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTION NURSE
dialogues.text: We’re a mental health facility. Our records are private.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: (putting on the charm) She’s probably been dead for forty years, you really think she cares?  75.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTION NURSE
dialogues.text: Our new file system doesn’t even go back that far. Sorry. Just as they are about to give up, Stella takes a flyer -

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: They wouldn’t be in the... Red Room? The Nurse exhales smoke, suspiciously eyeing them. She le back and calls out to a passing ORDERLY.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTION NURSE
dialogues.text: Gene, where are we storing the lapsed files?

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY GENE
dialogues.text: In the red room of the old building. But it’s all locked up. The Nurse hands them a clipboard with paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTION NURSE
dialogues.text: Fill out an authorization request and maybe we can get it to you in seven to ten business days. (amused by their anguish) Need a pen?

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: (takes clipboard) Got one. Thanks. They slowly make their way out. Ramon tosses the clipboar the trash and they leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk behind the renovated hospital to discover -- A DECAYING, THREE STORY SANITARIUM behind it. All windows doors are boarded up. Thick chains on the door.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: To what extent is your criminal capabilities?

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: There’s no way I can get in it... (mind racing) But maybe we could get on it.  76. Ramén points up to the roof. There’s a SMALL DIVIDE betwe the two buildings.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we can get up to the third story, we might be able to cross over and gain access onto its roof.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: That’s all you. I have no desire to see this red room. Stella eyes a COUPLE walking with a PATIENT IN A HAZEL GO

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: That’s the same gown Sarah wore.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: We're close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ‘LAUNDRY’ door opens -- Stella and Ramén exit, pushing wheelchair with Auggie dressed in a HAZEL PATIENT GOWN. T wheel him down an institutional corridor.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: (re: hazel gown) Just till we get to the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: No further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PASSING NURSE drops off a stack of papers in front of t Reception Nurse. The top page catches her eye -- SCHOOL PICTURES of Ramon, Stella and Auggie.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTION NURSE
dialogues.text: What are these?

dialogues.speaker: PASSING NURSE
dialogues.text: Apparently there’s a warrant out for their arrest. Her cigarette hangs from her lip, recognizing the faces. instantly goes to her phone, dialing the police.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén wheel Auggie onto an empty elevator. The push the 3rd floor button. Just as the doors close - A MEATY HAND JUTS IN, allowing an ORDERLY to enter.

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: I think you want the fifth floor. Brown gown, fifth floor. He hits the 5th floor button for them. They smile. The Orderly eyes Auggie, giving him a quizzical once over The elevator is unusually quiet on their way up. Then -- Ding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open to the sound of strange moaning and errati screams. The occasion banging. The Orderly holds the door open so Stella and Ramén can p Auggie out, though they are unsure where they’ve been tak

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: Be well, big fella. He gives a warm smile, then the elevator seals behind the

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Mental patients guzzle pills and struggle to cope. All in hazel scrubs.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: You're conscious. Not crazy, right? Auggie frantically looks around, ultra-sensitive to his surroundings. The walls and linoleum are all a stark whit

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: At least there’s no red. With the coast clear, they wheel Auggie further into the restricted portion of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. We’ll make this quick. They duck down a hallway, keeping out of the orderlies si  78. They pass windows, where -- a patient pulls clumps of hai from his scalp... Another patient screams from behind gla

dialogues.speaker: MENTAL PATIENT
dialogues.text: I don’t want the drum. I promise to be good. I want my mommy back.

dialogues.speaker: MENTAL PATIENT
dialogues.text: Wait till Martin comes! They pass drugged patients sleeping in a room. They quick wheel inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients are too doped up to notice as the three go t window and spot the rotting rooftop of the old sanitarium floors below. Auggie hops out of the wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: I'll keep watch. Auggie guards the open doorway, on the lookout. Stella and Ramén open the large window, judging the dista

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: A little high. If the book doesn’t kill us, the jump might. Quick thinking, Stella pulls a stained SPRING MATTRESS of empty bed, dragging it to the window.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good thinking. They throw the mattress over the divide. It drops down un landing in a plume of dust on the roof, two stories below

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: You think we can make it? Ramén judges the distance, then carefully throws the Book down in a test run... It misses the mattress, by a lot. Stella throws Ramén a look - seriously?

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Ladies first?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: We go together.  79.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Just make it quick, will ya? A drugged patient wakes up. He points to Auggie, moaning. AUGGIE POV: Down the corridor, the elevator opens with th Orderlies, Reception Nurse, and Deputy Hobbs.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. The fuzz. Hurry. Hurry. Ramén climbs out onto the ledge and helps Stella out. A f story fall onto a sidewalk if they don’t make the jump. Stella looks back at Auggie.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Catch ya later.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Not if ya catch a disease. Now all of the drugged patients have awoken, making an incredible racket, sure to draw attention. Ramén holds Stella’s hand tight.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Together?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Together.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Go, go, go -- ! Outside, the Deputy and staff are about to pass the room

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: Stella and Ramén JUMP together... Sneakers kicking in the air... Over the expanse... Falling...

dialogues.speaker: ON ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén CRASH onto the mattress -- they made it! But the mattress CRASHES through the rotted roof! They sc as the roof collapses below them. Leaving a gaping hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Hobbs and the staff look into the bemoaning patien room. Auggie disguised himself in an empty bed, wailing t They move on in their search. When the coast is clear, Auggie bolts to the window and s the hole in the roof below.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén writhe on their mattress on a hallway fl showered in wood and debris. As the dust settles, they sit up. Hair askew. Amazed to f they're alive. Ramén pulls a splinter from her hair.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: We make a great team. Stella rolls her eyes and rises. The two find themselves In a dark, decomposing corridor to a place long forgotten Sunlight from narrow, inescapable windows accentuate the molting walls. Wire bed frames and discarded furniture le Spooked, the two gingerly move down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This wasn’t a hospital, it was a prison...

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Let’s just find her file and get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramén kicks open a door, allowing them into the basement floor where a large ‘B’ is prominently displayed on a wal More importantly, THE CEMENT FLOOR AND WALLS ARE PAINTED

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: It’s just like he said.  81. Stella turns on the musty fixtures in the RED RECORDS ROO Dank, in disarray. CLUTTERED file boxes scrawled with dat as far back as the 1880’s. There must be hundreds of them Stella and Ramén begin looking through the disarray, floo ceiling red.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Aren't files supposed to be ‘filed’? Off their desperate search --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auggie casually rolls himself down a white hallway in his wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: I love white. White Christmas, white bread, white people... As he rolls past the VENDING MACHINE --

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: White chocolate... Auggie fishes some coins from his pocket, and selects a w ZERO CANDY BAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén sit amongst piles of files, lost.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: There’s nothing on her. It’s like she didn’t even exist. Defeated, Stella grabs the next file box to inspect -- Ramén sits up, stares at something OFF SCREEN. Stella follows his gaze to a TURNED FILE BOX spilling a d or so LEATHER-BOUND LEDGERS - IDENTICAL TO THE BELLOWS BO

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (mind races) «.. Just like her Book. The two sit close, pouring through the ledgers. An intima both are comfortable with; even yearn for. In the ledgers  82. Instead of scary stories, they are filled with dated pati reviews, x-rays, photos -- Stella looks at the file in his hand: Autopsy reports for group of children - the ones Sarah allegedly had murdered

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are medical charts... for the kids that disappeared. (reviewing statistics) They suffered from liver failure. They were sick from lead poisoning. Ram6én pauses, trying to recollect --

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Back at the library. On the map. Their rail yard was built on the Yamhill River. They dammed that creak the year they locked her up in here. The truth hits Stella like a punch to the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: She didn’t murder them. Her family did to bury their secret.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: (re: file) Look who’s her supervising doctor -- Ramén shows her Sarah's weekly reports, patient reports “Milner, Alfred, Dr.” “Severe paranoia... imaginative constructs... false stories, family lies...”

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (reading) «+. Dr. Alfred Milner. Roy Milner’s father?

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: (reading) “Electroshock, metrozol, radium and isolation therapy, lateral cerebral diathermia treatment... “ (beat) Jesus, she was just sixteen and they tortured her...

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (mind racing) They made her believe she did it... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: that’s why the stories keep happening. (resolute) Is there a death certificate? Proof that they killed her? What they did with her remains? Ramén gets a closer look at two faded forms.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: (reading) “Sessions terminated at family request”. -- She didn’t die here, she was discharged.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: That can’t be, that doesn’t make any sense -- Stella compares the two forms: Under the line ‘# administered’ a “1” is admitted, then a “2” on release.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It says here one patient was admitted, and two were released. Sarah left with a woman named Beatrix Bellows.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: I thought her mom’s name was Delores. Did she have a sister? Stella shakes her head, consumed. They both share a look, trying to make sense of things. A PAIR OF HANDS jut out at them through a file shelf, belonging to an oafish ORDERLY dressed in white.

dialogues.speaker: THERE YOU ARE
dialogues.text: Stella falls back. Ramén pushes the shelf atop of him -- giving them a chance to flee, leaving the evidence behind

dialogues.speaker: SANITARIUM HALLWAYS
dialogues.text: The two quickly scramble through dark hallways, racing pa large debris. The Orderly follows but they’re too quick. They BURST open the door -- but it’s held by chains outsi Stella’s small frame squeezes through, but Ramdén struggl He manages to escape mere moments from the Orderly’s capt  84. They back up as his arm blindly grabs for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén find parked police cars out front. They into a side door into the renovated hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén hurry, scanning for Auggie.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: The Orderly loses sight of the teens in the hospital. He activates an emergency alarm button. KLAXONS sound off--

dialogues.speaker: IN FIRST FLOOR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén witness RED WARNING LIGHTS, causing ever white wall to appear red!

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: «+. The red room.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Auggie!! Ramén skims ‘The Dream’ in the Bellows Book, quickly skip to the end. He goes grim.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: We shouldn’t have gone to the fifth floor. They frantically search --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Where’s the elevator?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auggie tenses, bathed in a sea of red. He drops his candy wheels out as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Red room. Red room. RED ROOM!!! Auggie abandons his wheelchair, toppling it over as he charges out into a full sprint.  85. Everywhere Auggie turns is red. There is no escape yet he desperately runs. When he rounds a corner -- He comes upon an ENDLESS CORRIDOR THAT STRETCHES OUT TO INFINITY. Almost like a dream. Auggie pivots around, only to find he’s trapped inside so kind of labyrinth of red corridors. The sounds of the rea world drown out, as if underwater.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sotto) I’m not crazy, I’m conscious. I’m not crazy, I’m conscious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hospital is in chaos - patients huddled or screaming, orderlies trying to restrain their patients. Their voices drowned out by the emergency klaxons. Stella and Ramén find the elevator and frantically push t call button.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: C’mon... Cc’mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auggie charges down another endless red corridor and turn find a dead end. Unable to escape the nightmarish red maz Auggie stops, sobbing in fear. In his state of panic, he fails to notice - On the wall behind him, a TINY POINT OF PLASTER CRACKS, leaking trails of water, red as blood. The fissures sprea releasing a trickle of river water... and what looks to b FINGER poking through. Followed by a RED ARM punching through the wall!

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Turns and finds a sinewy ARM protruding through the wall, grasping. The limb unnaturally long for the human body. Chips of plaster flake off as the hole gets bigger. Anoth elongated limb breaks through. We know who this is.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Nononononononono -- !  86. The wall breaks as a besmeared RED SARAH BELLOWS is birth from out of the seeping wall. Auggie trembles as the story comes true. He SCREAMS and R Sarah Bellows shuffles behind, her twisted, naked and coa body leaving a trail of red footprints behind.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM HALLWAYS
dialogues.text: Auggie flees through winding, endless red corridors. He struggles with a handle. He BANGS on a door.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: HELP!!! IT’S HER! IT’S THE WITCH! After every turn, Auggie looks back and finds the slow-mo Sarah surprising closer.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH BELLOWS
dialogues.text: Youuu Maaay Beee Theee Neeext... Auggie darts down another hallway, only to find Sarah now there too. Always a little closer.

dialogues.speaker: MAZE OF HALLWAYS
dialogues.text: Auggie turns and tries to escape. Panting. As he runs, he passes a window with people, only it’s -- The BELLOWS FAMILY sitting around their lavish dinner tab in their house. They turn to stare with gaunt faces. Inst of a ham displayed in the middle of the feast, it’s a chi decapitated head on a platter. No older than ten. Auggie moves past the dream-like window. Refusing to quit

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: I’m not crazy, I’m conscious. I’m not crazy, I’m conscious... He turns a corner, and there’s Sarah again, shuffling clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist Nurse spots Stella and Ramén waiting for elevator.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTION NURSE
dialogues.text: You!  87. She charges with two large Orderlies -- The elevator door opens. Stella and Ramdén race inside an push the fifth floor button. The doors seal just in time. Inside, they share a hopeful glance, but the floor number are slow to change. First level... ... second level...

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Sarah just twenty feet behind him, Auggie turns anot corner and finds THE ELEVATOR! He rapidly hits the call button. Eyeing Sarah shuffling towards him.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Come on... He tries to pry the doors open to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén tensely watch the floor numbers on the elevator rise. Third level... fourth level... They wait for the fifth level...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ding! The elevator arrives before Auggie. His face awash hope, awaiting for the doors to open. Sarah nearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their elevator chimes for Stella and Ramén. But when the doors open -- They discover their elevator HAS BEEN CALLED TO THE 4TH FLOOR, where Deputy Hobbs stands with his back turned. Ramén tries to hit the button again, but Hobbs turns and quick to draw his gun on them.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: Out of the elevator! Your hands up!  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Auggie’s elevator door opens, but it’s occupied by ORDERL The klaxons instantly shut off and the hallway returns wh More importantly, SARAH HAS DISAPPEARED. Auggie trembles fright, confused.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: The witch... she was just here! The Orderlies suspiciously eye him in his red patient gow

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She almost got me! T-the room was red, and... (catches on) «+. No, no, it’s not what you think. They firmly grab hold of him.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No wait! I don’t belong here! I snuck in. I’m not crazy!

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: Sure. Sure you aren’t.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: NO! PLEASE! I’M NOT CRAZY!!! I'M

dialogues.speaker: THE WITCH
dialogues.text: The Orderlies drag Auggie away behind two doors that read ELECTROCONVULSIVE SHOCK THERAPY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Orderlies strap Auggie into a STRAIGHT JACKET.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE
dialogues.text: Please. I-I’m not crazy -- They restrain Auggie down onto a gurney.

dialogues.speaker: AUGGIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t want this to be the way it ends... I SHOULD'VE READ... I SHOULD'VE READ... RED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shut him up by a wooden handle between his teeth. Au lets out a muffled SCREAM as they begin strapping electro to his temples. He shakes his head, unable to stop it. The electroshock machines charge up with electricity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén are distraught as their handcuffed when BZZ2ZZ2ZZZ - The lights FLICKER as a surge of power is fe throughout the hospital. Along with Auggie’s distant SCRE

dialogues.speaker: TIME SLOWS AS
dialogues.text: Ram6én withers, deeply devastated. Stella releases a long, ANGUISHED SCREAM. She falls upon knees as the Deputy restrains her. Stella is laid to wast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLANG! An old JAIL DOOR is slammed shut on Stella. Ramén in his own cell, sharing a wall of bars between them. The room is bare, save for a fireplace and a folding chair. Deputy Hobbs locks up.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: You don’t understand. We’re innocent! The Book is cursed, man!

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: Sure it is. While Ramén fights for his life, Stella slumps in a corne

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: At least give us the book before it’s too late! If we could save Alice, we can save ourselves!

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: You didn’t hear? Alice died_on the way to the hospital. Ramén pales. Stella scoffs - despondent.  90.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatever you guys are into, I'd start telling the truth. Cause someone’s gotta pay.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: We ARE telling the truth! Deputy Hobbs leaves as their pleas fall on deaf ears, tak the Book with him. Ramén falls to the ground. Defeated.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (numb ) They don’t believe us... just like they didn’t believe Sarah. Alice died... just like the story said. Whatever’s written, comes true.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: So the son of a war hero, dies a two-bit hood.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: I don’t think--

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter what you think. It’s the stories you leave behind. What people believe... It’s all stories... They come up with the right lies and we go to war -- they say the freeway will bring progress and it kills the town. He hits his head against the wall, remembering something can’t get out of his head.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When my father returned from war, when I was a kid, I remembered the ticker tape that would fall out of his clothes. They couldn’t look at him, but they loved him. (beat) I hated him. When I caught up enough courage, I finally asked him. ‘What kind of father would jump on a grenade, knowing he had a kid back at home.’ Y’know what he said? (to Stella) ‘What sort of father would I be if I hadn't?’  91. Stella sees Ramén in a new light. He makes himself laugh, perhaps to prevent his tears.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn’t understand it at the time. But after all of this shit... If I get outta here, I’d do the same.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: My father will never know. If I could to talk to him -- tell him I believe him now. (hopeless) We’re gonna die. But I wanna live. (resolute) I want to live. Ram6én grabs her hand between the bars, trying to comfort But they both know their fate is all but sealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deputy Hobbs sits at his desk, awaiting Sheriff Milner. H reads the Bellows Book, with TRIGGER laying at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: (to Trigger) Can you believe what the kids these days are reading? He turns a page to a new chapter “Me Tie Dough-ty Walker” notice it’s no longer blank, but covered in writing. As he reads, his brows narrow. Eyes locked in. Could it b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén rise as Deputy Hobbs forcefully enters. palpable tension in the air. The man looks unhinged.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: How’d you get my name in that book? They share a look of distress, unsure how to answer. Hobbs opens the cylinder to his revolver and inserts bull

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: It writes itself. But your name shouldn’t be in it. You never went into the hou--  92. He closes the cylinder and points his gun at Ramén. He fi BANG! The bullet SPARKS off a cell bar. Stella screams.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth, wetback. (beat) Now I have questions and one of you will give me answers. Hobbs keeps the gun pointed at Ramdén as he talks to Stel DEPUTY HOBBS (CONT’D) That’s one sick story you wrote, but how did you know you’d be locked up in here?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Please. It’s like he said. It wasn’t us, it was the-- BANG! Another fire RINGS out! This time making contact wi the brick wall over Ramén’s head! They SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: Did he bring you into this? Handsome, older boy, invites you into some trouble?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: We went into the Bellows house... And found that Book... Kurt followed us in... Hobbs aims his anger and his gun at the cowering Ramén, h sure not to miss this time. Stella talks twice as fast.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sarah Bellows, she murdered our friends, and Kurt, and my mom. Please - you have to believe us- It’s the truth...

dialogues.speaker: THAT AIN'T THE TRUTH
dialogues.text: Hobbs points the gun at Stella, a fed up man.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (through sobs) You have to tell my dad... I know it wasn’t him... It was Sarah in the car... Just tell my dad... We didn’t write the stories -- As Stella weeps, Hobbs keeps his gun trained on her. Then Trigger casually saunters in as the tension hits its clim All three eye the dog as it sits and curiously stares at fireplace, as if awaiting something. The dog yelps and whines at the hearth, as if trying to s actual words - ‘Wee rai rowly rawer’. Hobbs lowers his revolver, even more perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: That was in the story. How’d you make my dog do that? Stella and Ramén share a startled look, realizing...

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Who else’s name is in the story? Trigger wags his tail, staring off at something unseen. H whimpers. All three look at the chimney, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: You okay, boy? He tries to comfort his dog, only it won’t break its star from the fireplace. He yelps louder, ‘WEE RAI ROWLY RAWER

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with him? They stare at the mutt, trying to decipher the strange do like moaning. Almost like words. It dawns on Stella first

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: ‘Me Tie Dough-Ty Walker’. Trigger, louder: ‘WEE RAI ROWLY RAWER! WEE RAI ROWLY RAWE

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Who’s name is in the story?! They back away in their cells - hope fleeting.  94.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: What’d you do to my dog?!

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: PLEASE! You have to let us out of here.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: One of us is gonna die next. Who’s name is in the story?!

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: (fed up, to Ramén) Yours, okay? It’s you. Stella looks to Ramén - his heart skips a beat. Trigger skitters, barking at the fireplace. Something HARD AND FLESHY bounces down the chimney, then The BLOODY HEAD of SARAH BELLOWS rolls across the floor a comes to a stop!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH BELLOWS HEAD
dialogues.text: ...-Youuu maaay beee theee neeext... Deputy Hobbs’s eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: What the f--

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Listen to me. If we don’t get out of here, Ramén is going to die. Deputy Hobbs snaps out of it and grabs his key ring but - Trigger TURNS ON his master with a low and guttural growl

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY HOBBS
dialogues.text: Boy, it’s me... The dog snaps and starts BARKING. Drool foams from his mo

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Don’t just stand there, GET ME

dialogues.speaker: OUTTA HERE
dialogues.text: TWO ROTTED FEET tumble from out of the hearth next. Deputy Hobbs isn’t sure what to do, but finally moves to unlock the teens, when --  95. Trigger CHOMPS onto his arm! He SCREAMS in pain as he dro his keys just short of Stella’s cell. Trigger thrashes as Deputy Hobbs HOWLS. Ramén can do nothing but watch the horror unfold. Stella reaches for the keys, but they are just out of gra TWO ROTTED LEGS topple from the fireplace and then attach themselves to the feet. FLESHY BODY PARTS spasm on the ground like suffocating fi A TORSO and CHEST CAVITY wriggle up to the legs, rising before them. Then chunks of shoulder meat... a pair of forearms, rotted hands... and finally a smiling head... SARAH'S DISJOINTED AND ROTTED BODY rises. She lurches tow the wailing Sheriff -- held down by Trigger, further sink his teeth into his master’s arm. Deputy Hobbs looks up in horror at the smiling face of Sa She looks him deep in the eye -- then SNAPS his neck! The Deputy’s body lands with a THUD! Stella and Ramén rea all hope of their escape now dead on the ground. Rotted Sarah rears her neck -- staring at Ramén. Sarah st to lurch toward his cell.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Open it! Open it!

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: I can’t reach the keys! Ramén backs away as Sarah hobbles outside his cell, her a reaching through the bars. Sarah begins to SQUEEZE her rotten head through the bars. skull crunches and indents, allowing her head THROUGH.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: My arm isn’t long enough!! Sarah dislocates her shoulder, pushing one arm through, t CRUNCHES her chest cavity through. She’s inside! Rotted Sarah grasps for Ramén, when - Stella REACHES through the bars and GRABS Sarah!  96. The mere touch of her causes Stella’s eyes to turn white she begins to CHOKE -- water pours out of Stella’s mouth

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Stella! --Stella’s deadening eyes look up -- The bright lamps abo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNDERWATER —- TIME UNKNOWN Stella is suddenly SUBMERGED underwater. A hand tight aro her neck. But as she tries to make out what is on the oth side of the water’s surface -- -- it isn’t Sarah. But Sarah’s Father, ARNOLD BELLOWS. Th sons surround the patriarch, watching Stella drown. A col matriarch holding an infant watches on without interventi She tries to scream, but can’t get any air out of her lun She fixates on something over the faceless men -- A PAIR MASONRY CHIMNEYS that belong to THE BELLOWS MANSION. Just as Stella’s eyes drift closed and her body goes limp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramén sees their struggle has kicked the keys closer to h He reaches out and stretches for the keys. He snares them After unlocking himself, he sees Stella holding Sarah bac Drowning from the water pouring out of her mouth... Ramén grabs the revolver off the floor and -- BANG! BANG! BANG! BANG! Bullets STRIKE the corpse of Sara TORQUING her body free from Stella! CLICK! CLICK! CLICK!. Stella falls to the floor in a heap, gagging and coughing Ram6n opens her cell and helps Stella to her feet. She struggles to catch her breath. Still alive, Rotted Sarah LUNGES for Ramén again -- --only for him to SLAM the cell door closed on her!

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Come on! Ram6én grabs Stella’s hand --  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before they race out of the main office -- Stella breaks grip with Ramon... to retrieve the Bellows Book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramén opens the squad car, but it’s locked. Stella anxiou TRIGGER jumps on the hood of the car, SNARLING. They YELL The SARAH BELLOWS’ CORPSE stumbles her way towards them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a POLICE CRUISER barrels into Sarah! She EXPLOD and rains down in body parts. A window lowers, revealing SHERIFF MILNER. Looking spooked.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: Get in! Stella and Ramén dive into the car, closing the door just Trigger attacks, clawing at the window. Milner can’t take his eyes off the body parts on the stre ahead, flopping on the pavement. Some begin to rejoin, sl rebuilding back into a rotted Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her head rolls to a stop, SCREECHING a deafening SCREAM! cruiser’s wheels kick up dirt and peel off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Sheriff Milner drives, Stella and Ramén gasp in relief They know they were saved from an inch of their lives. Ram6n clings to the mesh screen dividing them.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU!

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: You saw it too? Thank GOD you saw it! You finally believe us.  98.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: That’s what killed your son. And will kill us too unless we get as far away from here as possible... Stella starts to read the rest of ‘Me Tie Dough-ty Walker

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The stories. There’s no way to stop them once they’ve been written.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: That was Sarah Bellows? Ramén has never heard sweeter words.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: You even know her name?! I love you, man. I love the law! Just drive, man. Open her up. (to Stella) How do I die in the end? Stella finishes reading to herself, then mournfully looks

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s okay... I can handle it. I'd rather know. She catches the Sheriff's cold glance in the rearview mir

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: He shoots you. Milner drives coolly, never taking his eyes off the road.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: (incredulous) What? You’ve got to be kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: His father... he was the doctor in charge at the hospital. He helped the Bellows cover it up. The CB radio sparks up. An out of jurisdiction DISPATCHER

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sheriff, we're getting an unusual amount of calls. Are you picking up the phone-- The Sheriff clicks off his CB. They drive in eerie silenc  99.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: You just had to go into that damn house. They try to force their doors open, to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE CRUISER
dialogues.text: As the cruiser drives down a deserted highway... Stella and Ramén claw at the doors and window -- kicking screaming -- but their muffled cries for help go unnotice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff's cruiser passes through the property gates a crosses a small bridge over a dry riverbed, winding up th hill to where the Bellows mansion once stood. The entire estate has been razed down to dirt and debris, except for the brittle remains of the dual chimney stacks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser has parked beside a dry riverbed and a small MASONRY ARCH-WALL DAM. Beyond it, the remains of a river along with rusty iron frames, chloridized leeching tanks, drain boxes make up the derelict rail yard. Headlights illuminate the dam, where Sheriff Milner has a shovel, pick axe and some bags of cement.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK OF THE CRUISER
dialogues.text: Stella and Ramén struggle, both of their hands now cuffed behind their back. She spots the dual chimney stacks and wanes as she recogn it as the location from her vision.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: This is where they took her. This is where her family murdered her.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Misery loves company.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: (struck) They buried the bodies in the dam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stacks of cobblestone are piled aside as Milner digs a sh into fresh earth. A hole big enough for two graves. He sweats with each burrow into the ground. His voice rai

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: I was told I only needed to keep the secret -- But then your mother had gone into that house -- Now ‘cause of you, my son is dead - And once you’re dead and buried, everything will settle down -- Just as it always does. His shovel scrapes dirt aside, incidentally exposing the skeletal remains of an ABNORMALLY ENLARGED SKULL. Milner keeps digging, paying no mind.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK OF THE CRUISER
dialogues.text: Stella writhes as they try to escape. She presses her fac against Ramén’s in what appears to be a passionate gestur

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: (shared passion) If this is it, may as well -- Ramén attempts to meet her lips, but it isn’t reciprocate Stella scrunches to get her arms under her rear, bringing cuffs in front of her. It finally dons on Ramén--

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh good. You can do that. (turning) Now help me out. Stella ignores Ramén in favor of grabbing the Bellows Boo

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? With her hands cinched, she opens to the last chapter. Th story of ‘The Haunted House’ is still unwritten.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Whatever is written, comes true. (searching) Pen... pen... pen...

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: What?  101.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: We have to write her story. It’s the only way for her to hear the truth. Ram6n catches on. He turns his pelvis to her.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Front pocket. Stella grabs Auggie’s old broken pen. Ramén keeps one eye on Milner as Stella begins writing. H words escape her lips as if in a fever dream.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: “Sarah Bellows was a sweet, young- lonely girl whose parents never let her out of the house...” Ramén looks out the window and goes in awe at something O

dialogues.speaker: ON SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: He finishes mixing some wet cement in a wheelbarrow. He r and wipes his brow. The wind howls and sweeps past him. Feeling watched, he slowly turns, his frame moving aside Revealing THE BELLOW’S HOUSE fully rebuilt in the distanc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner can’t believe his eyes. He looks to the cruiser an his eyes narrow on Stella writing in stride. He stabs his shovel into the earth.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK OF THE CRUISER
dialogues.text: Stella now sees the house on the hill, gobsmacked.

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: Write, Stella. Hurry! She returns to scribbling out words, almost illegible, wh Stella's door rips open and she is YANKED out of the car. Book goes flying along with her glasses.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: YOU DON’T KNOW WHAT YOU’RE DOING! Stella hits the dirt hard. She struggles to see, but spot her glasses behind her, and the Book between her and Miln Fuck the glasses. She crawls toward the Book.  102. Milner approaches, taking his revolver out of the holster SHERIFF MILNER (CONT’D) Don’t you see, darling? If they found out the water was spoiled, there would be no Mill Valley... Ramén sees this as his chance. He gathers his courage -- From out of the cruiser comes a warrior’s cry. Ramén LAUN himself out of the back and TACKLES Milner to the ground. Stella grabs the Book but is vexed - she knows Ramdén wil never win this fight with his hands cuffed behind his bac

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: No, your story --

dialogues.speaker: RUN, STELLA, WRITE
dialogues.text: As Ramén and Milner wrestle, Stella takes the Book and da towards the Bellow’s House, tripping over the tall grass. Milner tries to get to his gun, but Ramén does everything his power to stop him. He’s thrown back -- Ramén’s face hits the dirt, in plain view of -- Headlights illuminate an upright pick axe dissecting the printed words on a box of “MEATIER SAND” and “DOUGHTY WAL CEMENT” to reveal the words “ME TIE DOUGHTY WALKER”. Ram6n smirks as it gravely dons on him --

dialogues.speaker: RAMON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So that’s why it’s called that.

dialogues.speaker: ON STELLA
dialogues.text: As she approaches the Bellow’s House, a deafening GUN SHO rings out into the night. She stutters, fearing Ramén’s f But she continues on, never looking back.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND HER
dialogues.text: Milner rises out of the tall grass.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF MILNER
dialogues.text: Come back here, Stella!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another gunshot rings out and the bullet whizzes by. Hear racing, she enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella bursts through the front door, confused and alone. only the place isn’t cold and crumbling, but warm and lav The fixtures cast the elegant interiors in a ghostly ligh Confused, she returns to writing in the Book, reciting:

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: “Sarah felt alone, so she wrote scary stories for the children. And they would come visit from all around for they loved to hear her read...” The sounds of CHILDREN LAUGHING. Little feet PITTER-PATTE across wood floors, gathering someplace. Stella peers into the grand library, where it’s now lined with books. A YOUNG SARAH sits in a rocking chair with a large GROUP OF CHILDREN seated around her. She smiles as finishes reading a story she’s written in a child-like vo

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SARAH
dialogues.text: ..."He’s not a hairless”, the Vet said, “He’s not even a dog.”

dialogues.speaker: CHILD
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SARAH
dialogues.text: It was a sewer rat with rabies! The kids squeal with laughter and scares, while Sarah gig and enjoys telling the spooky tale. It’s as if the ghostl inhabitants of yesteryear are pre-recorded memories. Stella has a bewildered look - Is this really happening? Suddenly, the front door to the manor SLAMS OPEN, reveali SHERIFF MILNER. He reloads, but his bullets slip out of his hand as he is awestruck by the sudden transformation of the house. He gathers himself, then returns to the hunt.  104. A CHILD who Young Sarah is reading to turns his head to l straight at him, breaking the fourth wall. His skin is pa and sickly. River water starts pouring from his mouth. Milner fires at the apparition, to no effect. Realizing they’re no threat, the Sheriff continues after Stella.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Stella tries to find safe refuge to write. She hides betw an oven and wall, continuing to write --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: “One day, the children started to get sick. And Sarah knew it was the water. The water was being poisoned by her family's rail yard...” The pipes in the walls rattle. Household items tremble. T kitchen faucet BURSTS dirty water. It bleeds through crac in the wall, seeping out of ceilings and floors. All arou pools of river water gather. As if the house was weeping.

dialogues.speaker: IN A DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Milner is startled by the water pressure building and moa in the walls. He eyes the stairway where massive amounts river water waterfalls down. He spots movement in the kitchen and FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Stella SCREAMS as the bullet ricochets nearby. She breaks from her writing and races to the next room, getting wet.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIBRARY
dialogues.text: Stella enters the giant library where river water drains from above. She looks for a place to hide, then spots - The Alcaraz Rug covering the cellar hatch in the floor. S moves the rug aside and hides down in Sarah’s hidden bedr

dialogues.speaker: A MOMENT LATER
dialogues.text: Milner steps in. He uses his ears as much as his eyes. He studies the library. Shelves filled with a myriad of book

dialogues.speaker: IN SARAH'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Stella holds her breath below the hatch. Hoping it will w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milner’s boots step onto the Alcaraz rug, left askew. His boot takes another step. The hidden hatch creaks.

dialogues.speaker: IN SARAH'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Stella closes her eyes. Silently praying. All goes quiet.

dialogues.speaker: IN LIBRARY
dialogues.text: Milner’s foot casually pushes aside a corner of the rug t reveal the cellar hatch. He knows this is where she’s hid IN SARAH’S BEDROOM Stella holds her breath in fear, unable to write a word. Water seeps and drains into the basement room, pooling.

dialogues.speaker: IN LIBRARY
dialogues.text: Milner lowers down to lift the hatch door, when the wall books behind him MOVE. Some JUT OUT, others RETRACT -- creating the IMPRESSION OF SARAH’S FACE. When he slowly turns to witness it, Sarah’s impression op its mouth, inhaling books into a DARK, WIND TUNNEL ABYSS. Milner EMPTIES his gun, hitting nothing but books and parchment. The impression SCREAMS as the wind flurries. Milner’s hat is sucked off into the void. He digs his hee in to try to reload, but the gust takes his gun too. A look of fear washes over him as he is pulled toward the bookshelf. Heels scraping. He covers his face and then -- He SCREAMS as he is SUCKED into the abyss. The tremendous wind dies down as loose book pages flutter to the floor. IN SARAH’S BEDROOM Stella’s breath quickens. Unsure of what happened. She ho onto the hatch, questioning whether it’s safe to come out

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIBRARY
dialogues.text: A PAIR OF FEET step out from the void in the book shelf.. ROTTED SARAH limps into the library in her hazel gown. Crooked, elongated limbs. A damaged, child-like mind. Her mouth is agape with river water pouring out. Sarah lurches her mangled body towards the cellar hatch. IN SARAH’S BEDROOM  106. Stella decides it’s time to open the hatch, but -- SARAH’S MANGLED FACE IS RIGHT THERE! Stella SCREAMS. The hatch door CRASHES DOWN as she falls deeper into the cellar, splashing into the water now up t her waist. A BANGING on the hatch door. She’s trying to get in. Stella looks for a way out, but there is none. She reclai the Book... only now the pages are all wet. Regardless, she writes. The ink bleeding on the page.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “When the children started dying, Sarah confronted her family..." The BANGING intensifies. Stella writes on --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “But her family wouldn't listen to Young Sarah. And to protect the family name, they murdered the children and hid their bodies in the dam. And then told everyone that she was the monster.” MORE VIOLENT BANGING. It’s deafening... Then silence. EXT. MILL VALLEY STREETS —- NIGHT Driving his pickup, Oren overhears on the radio:

dialogues.speaker: DISK JOCKEY, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: I really don’t know what to make of it, but this is the third caller who’s called in to say something odd is going on over by the Bellows property. Don’t ask me what -- Oren yanks the steering, accelerating towards the propert INT. SARAH’S BASEMENT BEDROOM - SAME TIME Stella shivers, the rising water up to her chest. Her trembling hand struggles to write clearly.  107.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: “,.. Her family locked her away in Riverwell, where they made her forget the truth, so that she would believe her family's lies...” Behind Stella, Rotted Sarah’s cockeyed face slowly rises from out of the water, inside the room.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “And when she tried to fix what was broken, they murdered her -- with their bare hands... Sarah hated her family for their betrayal... So she cursed them and everyone who went into their house.” Rotted Sarah releases a banshee-like SCREAM! Stella drops the book into the dark water. She swims back pushes floating articles to create distance. She chokes on a mouthful of water as she searches the roo looking for the book. But now Rotted Sarah is gone too. Stella’s head cranks, trying to cover every direction. Something touches her back -- she spins to find -- the Bo Stella's feet find some footing standing on a dresser. Sh puts her pen back to paper, only it’s not writing anymore The parchment is completely waterlogged.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Come on. Please -- UNDERWATER POV: Stella’s vulnerable body. Her voice muffl Stella finds a quietness that comes over the room. The ripples calm... Without warning, Stella’s violently YANKED underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella thrashes and tries to kick free from Sarah's grasp The Book floats away from Stella’s grasp, sinking. Stella struggles for air, and to break free. The Book too from her grasp. She SCREAMS, releasing an explosion of bubbles, desperate to reach the surface. She's drowning and slowly losing consciousness. And then distant voice. Almost dreamy.  108.

dialogues.speaker: DINAH MICHAELS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don’t you want to know how the story ends?... I’1ll help you. Her mother’s voice stirs Stella awake from the sinking slumber. She KICKS her leg free from Sarah’s grasp... And explodes out of the water, filling her lungs with lif She ignores the Book and clears her throat. Confident.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: We're not all at fault. We didn’t do this to you, Sarah. My friends, Me... my mother... (infinite sadness) ... Her name was Dinah Beatrix Michaels. Rotted Sarah's curdled face slowly rises just a breath fr Stella’s. A newfound curiosity about what she is saying.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But she wasn’t always a Michaels... At first, she was a Bellows. Trembling, Stella continues, with her deepest confession.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She was your daughter you carried at Riverwell, wasn’t she? Do you remember? They ripped her out of your arms before they murdered you. Rotted Sarah is lost in a flood of painful memories. Stel holds strong, never taking her eyes off of Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You cursed your family and so you cursed mine. But you aren’t the monster, Sarah. They are. You don’t want to hurt anyone, because this isn’t you. You forgot who you are. Sarah's eyes fix onto Stella’s. A fleeting moment of clar The water level quickly continuing to rise.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a sweet girl, Sarah. And this is your story. Stella takes her last gulp of air as the water rises over their heads, submerging them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah no longer looks ‘rotted’ - Stella sees the real SAR BELLOWS for the first time. Sarah sweetly smiles and gently moves back a floating wis hair from Stella’s face. Just like LouLou described, she sight. A soul that has been set free from the lies that h been holding her hostage. The two women float in the center of the water-filled roo furnishings drifting about. If Stella could hold her brea forever, she would stay to look at her grandmother’s face CLOSE ON: The Bellows Book floats by to the last pages of Tie Dough-ty Walker” that describe Ramén’s death. The ink from the freshly written letters drift off the page... Stella is hypnotized by Sarah. She may never come up for The last bit of breath escaping her lips. And then -- The hatch opens above the surface, letting in light. An A PLUNGES into the water, pulling Stella up.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIBRARY
dialogues.text: Stella is yanked onto the library floor, GASPING for air, coughing. She is shocked to see -- Ramén, clutches his bloody gut from a near fatal bullet wound. Stella wraps her arms around him as he winces.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're alive!

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: You changed the ending. You saved me.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: We saved her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oren pulls to a stop at the Bellows Estate where some onlookers have gathered, sharing hushed whispers. His jaw drops seeing the newly restored BELLOWS HOUSE. Th front door opens, with Stella and Ramén exiting. Overcome with emotion, Oren pushes through the crowd to b with his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella turns to see her father. His presence is far more spectacular than anything that has happened to her.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: She runs to him. They meet in a long embrace. He holds he never wanting to let go. Through tears --

dialogues.speaker: STELLA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It wasn’t you... I know it wasn’t you. I know the truth.

dialogues.speaker: OREN
dialogues.text: The truth doesn’t matter, Stella. Only you do. I was so worried. (beat) What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Stories hurt. Stories heal. He breaks the embrace to look her in the eyes, as if to convince himself she really is okay... Stella beams, tears of joy in her eyes. A brightness exud Oren embraces her again. Their relationship made whole. H knows this isn’t his sad daughter anymore. Stella is rebo Stella closes her eyes, taking in the moment. Ramén is overjoyed at the sight, partly wishing his fathe was there too. But then he sees something horrific -- The front door to the house kicks open to a wind-ravaged SHERIFF MILNER! He looks like he’s crawled out of the slu from hell. He raises his gun, when - The ground beneath the Bellows House gives way, and a por of the estate collapses into a sinkhole. The startled crowd gasps. Sheriff Milner looks up at the house, unsure if the rest it is going to fall on him. Then -- THE BASE OF THE LOOMING ON-RAMP sinks into the ground. Th soaked foundation of earth grows unstable, causing rebar bend and groan, chunks of concrete to crumble from above. Before the Sheriff can run away, the entire crowd watches on-ramp all come CRASHING DOWN. He SCREAMS as -  111. CRAAAAASH! - a mountain of concrete and iron PLUMMETS dow DESTROYING the Bellows House and Sheriff Milner with it. As the dust settles, all that remains is a MOUNTAIN OF DEBRIS. Stella and Ramén eye the pile of rubble, unsure i it’s really over.

dialogues.speaker: OREN
dialogues.text: What just happened?

dialogues.speaker: RAMON
dialogues.text: I think she fixed things. Oren looks confused, but Stella knows he’s right. SLOWLY PAN UP on the three as the crowd behind them marve at the destruction of the Bellows House.

dialogues.speaker: DISK JOCKEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Happy Thanksgiving, Mill Valley, or should I say the new era of Dick. Richard Nixon can’t save us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last remaining Autumn leaves cling to frigid trees. A slight frost on people’s lawns. Winter at the doorstep.

dialogues.speaker: DISK JOCKEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Let me tell ya, folks... As much as this crazy world is filled with lies and hypocrisy, I like to believe there are still some stories out there worth a damn. And I’ve never found it more evident than right here in our backyard. A bundled Paper Boy slings NEWSPAPERS on his route. On th front page, a picture of the Bellows Family, Sarah, and t murdered young children.

dialogues.speaker: DISK JOCKEY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: She didn’t do it. Plain and simple. (beat) Why did we believe then? Cause we are afraid of what we don’t know. We're afraid of what’s in the dark. But when we turn on the lights... most of the time, it’s us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: City Workers and Detectives continue their arduous work a slowly breaking up the dam, removing skeletal remains.

dialogues.speaker: DISK JOCKEY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Wake up, people. Our forefathers... are cocksucking murderers. They've laid the pieces of bone on a tarp like a puzzle. the making of nine children, and one young adult.

dialogues.speaker: DISK JOCKEY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: And because our city is built on their evil deeds... The state did some soil tests, and wouldn’t you know, our land is foundationally unsound to build a freeway on. INT. MORALES’S HOME - NIGHT Ramén spoon feeds food into his father’s mouth as they wa TV in the family room. The distance that once divided the now gone.

dialogues.speaker: DISK JOCKEY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Our town lives again... for now. ON TV: Officials stand before a board, posting birthdates ascending order. Seated corespondent ROGER MUDD informs:

dialogues.speaker: ROGER MUDD
dialogues.text: Tonight for the first time in 27 years the United States has again started a draft lottery, and the famous first pick tonight is... Ramén hears something that gives him pause, the spoon lin in the air, frozen in time. It may as well be his birthda His mother’s hand comforts him. He looks to his father, f in his eyes. They meet in their fragility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stella lays a bouquet of yellow flowers at Dinah’s grave. Behind her stands Ramén, clean-shaven and in an army unif They walk past a few other gravestones that have been lef similar yellow bouquets... Auggie Hilderbrandt, Charles a Alice Steinberg, even Kurt Milner.  113.

dialogues.speaker: DISK JOCKEY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: So let’s be nice to each other, because eventually, we all have to move on. They meet at Oren’s pickup, its bed packed with moving bo Before Stella goes, she gives Ramén a lasting embrace. As they both know there may never be one again. For a moment, it looks like they may kiss, but they pull - knowing it’1ll only make it harder to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: DISK JOCKEY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: And wouldn’t you like to leave this world a little better than how you left it? I knows what I want to be played at my funeral. This is ‘Hey Jude’... The Beatles “Hey Jude” plays as Stella gets into her fath truck and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oren waits in his idling truck, ready to leave town for g Stella walks up the long driveway that leads to what is l of the Bellows Estate, holding one last bouquet for Sarah Wild flowers and tall grass have already started to grow the crevices of the ruined estate. Stella climbs to the top of the rubble, where a small tre has strangely already begun to sprout. She takes a moment herself. And gently lays the bouquet down. And then rests on the g looking up to the clear, blue sky.

dialogues.speaker: STELLA
dialogues.text: Lies- stories and lies... Now everybody knows. That you were not evil. That you were in pain. There was no darkness in your heart -- She looks up -- a black cloud crosses the sun -- -- then the sound of a faint music box. The playful melody -- You May Be the Next.  114. Concerned, Stella turns to see -- Her pretty yellow flowe brown and wilt before her eyes. They sour until they are nothing but crippled stalks. Even the Beatles rendition s and warps... like a broken record player underwater. Stella turns to her father, fearful of what may come next SARAH'S ROTTED ARMS erupt from the earth, CLUTCHING her! Stella SCREAMS BLOODY MURDER, as the arms pulls her down, into the earth -- Screaming.
